tha-ap116:0.2_0: The Longer Discourse on the Māluṅkya
tha-ap116:0.3_0: He is praised by the most senior monk.
tha-ap116:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Nādika.
tha-ap116:11.1_0: with eleventh senior monks, the fourth senior.
tha-ap116:3.3_0: Awakened as a fully awakened Buddha,
tha-ap116:3.4_0: I attended on the supreme awakening.
tha-ap116:4.1_0: I served them with Prince Bodhi,
tha-ap116:4.3_0: if he is sitting down cross-legged, with his body straight,
tha-ap116:5.1_0: They’ve gone forth through their own hard work,
tha-ap116:6.2_0: they consult me with their lovely,
tha-ap116:6.4_0: the sway of rebirth in this or that state.
tha-ap116:7.2_0: rebirth into all states of existence is eradicated,
tha-ap116:7.4_0: to the teaching of the Buddha.
tha-ap116:9.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
